p:
A high rate of venous thromboembolism (VTE) has been noted in COVID-19, occurring in up to one-third of critically ill patients, despite prophylactic anticoagulation.
51
,
52 Because JAK inhibitors carry a “black box warning” of increased VTE risk, there is reasonable concern that their use may increase the likelihood or severity of VTE when used in patients with COVID-19.
53
